intro: Barleria obtusisepala, commonly known as the broad-leaved barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy green surface and a slightly hairy texture. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Barleria obtusisepala is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
